page.title: 20Hogsthorpe Church.
page.content: St.Mary's Church at Hogsthorpe is built mainly from Ancaster Stone.It is partly Norman and Early English in style.Repair work in red brick spoils its looks.Inside is a rare unusual carved{corbell}head with a band across nose and chin.At the West end of the Church is a stained glass window of "OUR LORD BLESSING LITTLE CHILDREN". Inside the Churches large tower are 6 bells.Unfortunately,the ancient beams hoding the bells are now weak so instead of being rung by ropes normally,pulleys and ropes ring them by hammers striking the bells which are fixed so they can't move.The{pipe} {organ}pumped by Thomas S Jones and Son of Holloway,London. In 1851 a religious census said 150 people were regulars at Sunday Services.Today its about 25 to 30.
